result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (5th) and Operating w/ PAC (4th w/in 5 yrs). The defendant was found guilty of OWI (5th) and the other charge, Operating w/ PAC (4th w/in 5 yrs) was dismissed by the court.

  • Robert A Cluppert was found guilty of OWI (5th), a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Court has no objection to termination of probation after 2 years if all the conditions are completed and the Agent agrees to the early termination.

miscConds.notes: To be paid to the Clerk of Courts office.  Monies are to be paid during the term of probation.

timeConds.notes: Sentence to commence immediately.   Court grants huber, out of county service and out of county travel.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

Court goes over right to counsel and how to obtain one.

8:59 a.m.  Defendant present in court without counsel.  Agent Ryan Helmuth present in court.  Court questions defendant.  Statement by defendant.  Statement by Agent Helmuth, believes the defendant's payments are being paid on 2016CM119.  Statement by the court - explains a court review.  Court will schedule in another year.  Court will leave it up to the agent, if the defendant is making payments, the Court will cancel hearing.  If the defendant is not making payments, the hearing will remain on.
  
Court adjourned at 9:03 a.m.
(Atty Garcia)

records.addlTxt:
11:11 a.m.  Defendant present in court with Atty Danny Garcia.  Andrew Christenson for the State of Wisconsin and County of Green Lake.  Statement by Atty Garcia - will be a plea & sentencing.  DA recites agreement - in 2016CM119, the defendant will plea to OWI - 4th offense and in 2016CM148 defendant will enter a plea to an amended charge of OWI - 5th offense and the balance of the counts and 2016CM141, 2016TR785 will be dismissed and read-in.  Atty Garcias concurs.  Defendant concurs.

Court goes over plea questionnaire with the defendant.  Court goes over constitutional rights with the defendant - defendant waives these rights.  Court goes over the elements of each offense.  Court instructs defendant of the maximum penalty.  Court instructs defendant regarding deportation.  (If felony) Court instructs regarding felony prohibitions.

Defendant enters a plea of NO CONTEST.  Court finds the plea is made freely, voluntarily, intelligently and understandingly.  Court finds there is a factual basis to support the plea.  Court finds the defendant guilty as charged on count 1 on 2016CM119, orders count 2 be dismissed outright and orders count 3 be dismissed and read-in.  Court finds the defendant guilty on the amended count 1 (OWI-5th) on 2016CM148, orders count 2 be dismissed outright and count 3 is to be dismissed and read-in.  Court orders 2016CM141 and 2016TR785 be dismissed and read-in.  Court orders the judgment of conviction be entered here today.  Sentencing statement by DA.  Sentencing statement by Atty Garcia.  No statement by the defendant.

Court sentences the defendant to:

2016CM148 (OWI-5th)

-SWD, and places the defendant on probation for 3 years.

CONDITIONS:

-1 year county jail.  Court grants huber, out-of-county service and out-of-county travel.
-$600 fine plus court costs.  To be paid to the Clerk of Courts office.  Monies are to be paid during the term of probation.
-Blood Draw Fee - $42.50
-DL revocation - 3 years
-IID - 3 years
-AODA
-Defendant is to submit a DNA Sample.
-Defendant to re-pay the costs for court appointed counsel.

-Court has no objection to termination of probation after 2 years if all the conditions are completed and the Agent agrees to the early termination.

2016CM119 (OWI-4th)

-1 year county jail, concurrent to the sentence on 2016CM148.  Court grants huber, out-of-county service and out-of-county travel.
-$600 fine plus court costs.  Court grants the defendant 60 days to pay or payment plan.
-Blood Draw Fee - $42.50
-DL revocation - 3 years
-IID - 3 years
-AODA 
-Defendant is to submit a DNA Sample.
-Defendant to re-pay the costs for court appointed counsel.

Court grants Atty Garcia 30 days to submit the bill for court appointed attorney fees.

Court remands the defendant to the custody of the Green Lake County Sheriff's Department.
Court grants the defendant 2 days of sentence credit on 2016CM119.

Court adjourned at 11:27 a.m.
Plea/sentencing hearing on February 23, 2018 at 11:00 am.

8:36 a.m.  Defendant present in court with Atty Danny Garcia.  Andrew Christenson for the State of Wisconsin and County of Green Lake.  Statement by Atty Garcia - intend to proceed with plea & sentencing but need some guidance in regards to huber since this matter is an immediate remand.  DA recites offer, upon plea to OWI - 4th and OWI - 5th offense, will move to dismiss and read-in the bail jumping and TR citation.  Court questions Atty Garcia regarding contact with drug court.  Statement by Atty Garcia.  Statement by the Court - will adjourn matter for a couple of weeks for defendant to get his affairs in order.  No objection by DA Christenson.  Court sets for plea & Sentencing on February 23, 2018 at 11:00 a.m.  Court makes statement to the defendant.   Mandatory appearance.

Court adjourned at 8:45 a.m.
Scheduling
Plea/sentencing hearing on February 1, 2018 at 08:15 am.

8:16 a.m.  Defendant present in court with Atty Danny Garcia.  Andrew Christenson for the State of Wisconsin.  Statement by Atty Garcia - defendant does not want a jury trial and are working to see if the defendant would be a candidate for drug court.  Statement by DA - there is a possibility that a resolution can be worked out.  Statement by Atty Garcia.  Statement by DA Christenson.  Court sets for plea and sentencing on February 1, 2018 at 8:15 a.m.  Court cancels the jury trial. 

Court adjourned at 8:21 a.m.
Information
Scheduling

2:36 p.m.  Defendant present in court with Atty Danny Garcia.  Andrew Christenson for the State of Wisconsin.  Statement by the Court.  Statement by DA Christenson. Nothing further by Atty Garcia.  Further statement by the Court regarding prelims.  Aty Garcia to discuss the prelims with the defendant.  

Court recess at 2:38 p.m.
Court reconvened at 2:47 p.m.  Same appearances.  Statement by Atty Garcia - defendant will waive the preliminary hearing in each case.  Defendant concurs.  Court instructs the defendant regarding his right to a preliminary examination.  Defendant waives his right to a preliminary examination.  Court finds probable cause.  Court accepts the waiver of the prelim and binds the defendant over for trial.

State files an information in each case with the court.  Attorney Garcia and defendant acknowledge receipt of the information in each case and waives any reading.  Atty Garcia enters a plea of Not Guilty on behalf of the defendant.  Court will set for Jury Status Hearing on January 11, 2018 at 8:15 a.m. and Jury Trial on February 1, 2018 at 8:15 a.m.

Court adjourned at 2:52 p.m.
